Reference

Start with something

Functions for easy starting. Typically as an entry point in a pipe sequence.

start_with_mode()

Start with a mode

start_with_some_notes()

Start with a set of chosen notes

start_with_some_roles()

Start with a set of chosen roles

start_with_some_values()

Start with a set of chosen values (of an index)

Add information

Functions for adding columns.

add_notes()

Add notes to an xtibble object

add_roles()

Add roles to an xtibble object

Transform

Transform the index period and/or unit.

as_12_TET()

Set the attributes of an index so that it matches 12-TET

set_unit_to_fifths()

Set unit of an index so that it gets ordered by fifths

set_unit_to_1()

Set unit of an index to one

set_unit()

Set the unit of an index to a new value

set_period()

Set the period to a new value

set_zero()

Set zero on a value of the index itself or from an alternative source

set_first()

Set first of the set

S3 classes

Objects.

index() is_index()

index vector

xtibble() is_xtibble()

Create an instance of class m_xtibble

is_locked()

Test if the m_xtibble is locked

set_lock()

Lock or unlock an object of class m_xtibble

Data

More data to look at or start with.

get_roles()

Get roles

collapse_roles()

Collapse roles into a lower period

get_notes()

Get notes with zero of the index set to a root note

get_mode()

Get modes of seven or five notes

show_mode()

Show mode

get_data()

Get internally stored data

create_aeolian_A()

Create the aeolian A scale

create_chromatic()

Create chromatic scales

create_notes()

Create 31 notes

Other

Still ungrouped

shift_role() augment() diminish()

Augment or diminish roles

match_modes()

Match 5 and 7 modes

periodic_slice()

Slice an xtibble using index positions

example()

Construct tiny examples of objects of class m_index or m_xtibble

Superseded or discussed

Might not be necessary anymore.

break_point()

Break the index at a chosen value

Contents

Developed by Marc Carpentier.
